description:
Latin alternatio; compare French alternation.
Morphologically alternate +‎ -ion

entries.meaning: The reciprocal succession of (normally two) things in time or place; the act of following and being followed by turns; alternate succession, performance, or occurrence
examples: the alternation of day and night
alternation between night shifts and day shifts
alternation of feelings between hope and fear

entries.meaning: (religion) The response of the congregation speaking alternately with the minister.
examples: There are Anthems to be found amongst them , where every syllable has its just length ; each part of a sentence its proper pause : where the words are not confused by perplexing alternations, or rendered tedious by unnecessary repetitions

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A pattern by which more than one construct is possible, as with "Alice cooked Bob dinner" and "Alice cooked dinner for Bob".
(mathematics) A sequence that alternates between positive and negative values; sometimes incorrectly used to mean permutation.
(computing) A construct in a regular expression that can match any of several specified subexpressions.
(geometry) A type of partial truncation of a polygon, polyhedron or tiling in which alternate vertices are removed.
examples: This case suggests that the alternation of a polyhedron should be bounded by actual vertex figures and alternated faces. The case of the cube is in agreement with this notion, since the alternated square is nothing.
